org.codehaus.mojo.pde
Class AbstractEclipsePDEMojo

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo
      org.codehaus.mojo.pde.AbstractEclipsePDEMojo
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.maven.plugin.ContextEnabled, org.apache.maven.plugin.Mojo
Direct Known Subclasses:
EclipsePDECleanMojo, EclipsePDEMojo
public abstract class AbstractEclipsePDEMojo
extends org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo

Base class of all Eclispe PDE mojos

Version:
$Id:$

dtran@gmail.com

Field Detail

project

protected org.apache.maven.project.MavenProject project
The POM

pdeDirectory

protected java.io.File pdeDirectory
Contains the PDE project source

pdeProductFilename

protected java.lang.String pdeProductFilename
Build a product instead of a feature. If defined then a PDE Product will be built (instead of the feature, fragment or plug-in). This value defines the product file that will be used to build the product.

pdeBuildVersion

protected java.lang.String pdeBuildVersion
When a product build is run then use this version of the pde build scripts. The build scripts are located at ${eclipseInstall}/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build_{pdeBuildVersion}/scripts/productBuild

pdeBuildConfigDirectory

protected java.lang.String pdeBuildConfigDirectory
When a product build is run, then the location of the PDE build configuration directory must be specified. A product build will expect a build.properties file to exist in this directory. You can use ${eclipseInstall}/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build_{pdeBuildVersion}/templates/headless-build/build.properties as a starter file. See http://help.eclipse.org/help32/topic/org.eclipse.pde.doc.user/guide/tasks/pde_product_build.htm Building an RCP application from a product configuration file for more details.

eclipseInstall

protected java.io.File eclipseInstall
Eclipse Platform SDK Directory

Parameters:

convertPdeConfigsToFilenameSuffix

protected java.lang.String convertPdeConfigsToFilenameSuffix(java.lang.String configs)
                                                      throws org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
Convert the list of {os, ws, arch} configurations to build as contained in the build.properties file ${configs} field into the filename suffix for the created artifact. * Note PDE Build support multiple configs, here only one config is supported.

Parameters:
configs - the string form of the configs
Returns:
the filename suffix for the configs
Throws:
org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException - build failures.
